Get something that you can serve this mousse in, such as dessert glasses or ramekins. Fill to the top with chocolate mousse, then set in the fridge for at least 1 hour. Once mousse is set, top with soaked cherries and a sprinkle of crushed pistachios. Enjoy!

title: mint chocolate cupcakes
directions: 1. In a bowl combine the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt. In another bowl stir together the milk, white vinegar and mint extract. Set up a stand mixer and combine the sugar and butter in its bowl. Beat them together until fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time until they are fully incorporated.

2. Add one third of the dry ingredients and let that get incorporated, then add one half of the wet ingredients and let that get incorporated. Repeat with the next third of the dry ingredients and the remainder of the wet ingredients. Then finish with the remainder of the dry ingredients. Switch to a spatula and gently fold in the chopped Andes candies.

3. Preheat the oven to 325 F. Pull out two 12-count cupcake pans and line them with paper liners, with the second pan only getting 3 liners to make 15 total. Using a heaping 1/4 cup measure, scoop the batter into the prepared cupcake wells, then get them into the oven to bake for 30 minutes. Test them by seeing whether a toothpick inserted in the center of one comes out clean.

4. After the cupcakes are done, remove them from the oven and let them cool in the pan for a couple of minutes before you remove them to a rack to finish cooling. Let the cupcakes cool while you prepare the frosting. First, wash out the mixer bowl and paddle attachment since they will be needed.

5. Set up a double boiler by setting a heat proof bowl over a small pot of gently simmering water on the stove. Do not let the bottom of the bowl touch the water. In the heat proof bowl combine the chopped baker's chocolate, Andes candies and milk. Let it gently melt while you stir it into a smooth ganache. Transfer the ganache into the mixer bowl, along with the softened butter, salt and mint extract. Beat all of that together until smooth and creamy. Slowly add in the powdered sugar until it is all incorporated and you have a fluffy buttercream frosting.
6. Top each cupcake with two tablespoons of the frosting and smooth it out with an offset spatula or butter knife. Then decorate each one with an Andes candy on top. Serve and enjoy!

title: hot apple pie cocktail
directions: Add cider and Tuaca to a microwave-safe mug and heat to taste in the microwave. If desired, top with whipped cream and add a cinnamon stick for garnish.

title: millet vegetable soup
directions: Heat olive oil in a soup pot over medium-high heat. Add garlic and onions. Cook until onions have softened. Add remaining ingredients.
Bring soup to a boil; decrease temperature to medium. Let it simmer for 25 minutes or until the millet is completely cooked and soft.

title: gingerbread honey milkshake
directions: In the canister of a blender, combine all ingredinets. Blend until reaches desired consistency.
Pour into tall glass, top with crushed gingersnap cookies and whipped cream (if desired), and serve immediately. Enjoy!

title: skinny pomegranate martini
directions: Add vodka, pomegranate juice, sparkling water, orange juice and ice to a martini shaker (or covered container). Shake to mix thoroughly. Strain into a martini (or wine) glass.
Add about a 1 teaspoon fresh pomegranate seeds to martini and garnish with a slice of lime.

title: flaky apple phyllo pie
directions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
To prepare the apple filling, combine sliced apples, sugar, flour, cinnamon and vanilla extract in a mixing bowl. Set aside to prepare fillo crust.

Brush an 8- to 9-inch pie dish with butter. Carefully unroll the fillo dough and take one sheet and place it in the center of the pie dish. Brush with melted butter and be sure to coat the edges of the dough (edges and corners will dry out and flake off if they're not coated). Continue adding one layer of dough at a time and be sure to alternate the corners so that they circle the entire pie pan. Butter between each layer of dough. This process takes some time but is worth it.

Once all the layers have been buttered and stacked, fill with the apple mixture (you may need to strain off some of the juices) and level out the top. Next bring the corners of the dough in toward the center. Some of the apples in the center will be exposed. Brush the remaining melted butter over the top layers of fillo.
Bake for 30-35 minutes or until top is golden brown and flaky.

title: peppermint ganache pie
directions: Add chocolate chips and heavy cream to a microwave safe bowl. Cook until the chocolate is melted (I do 30-second intervals and scrape the sides of the bowl and stir each time). Once melted, pour into pre-made cookie crust.
Place in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours to set. Slice and serve with crushed peppermint and melted chocolate for garnish, if desired.

title: simple roasted fennel
directions: Preheat oven to 400°F and line a sheet pan with foil.
Arrange fennel rings and slices on the pan. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with fronds, salt, and pepper. Bake 25-30 minutes, or until tender and browned.

title: mint cream smoothie
directions: In a blender add yogurt, cream, and mint. Blend to combine. Pour into a chilled glass, garnish, sip and enjoy!

title: jalapeno brioche rolls
directions: Heat 2 tablespoons of butter in a pan over medium heat until melted. Add the jalapenos and saute until softened, about 5 minutes. Allow to cool. Combine the milk and the water and heat in the microwave for 10 seconds. Test the temperature (you want it between 105 and 110 degrees F) and repeat until the desired temperature is reached. Put your warm milk/water and sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer.
Sprinkle the yeast on top and allow it to get foamy, about 5 minutes.
Add the flour and salt, and with the dough hook attachment, mix on low speed until combined into a flaky ball (about 1 1/2 minutes). Add the eggs, one at a time, mixing until combined.
Add the remaining 2 sticks softened butter (softened is important) and the jalapenos. Beat until the dough gathers around the hook and is smooth and shiny.
Coat the inside of a bowl with olive oil and place the dough ball in it. Wrap with plastic wrap and leave in a warm place until double in size, about 1 1/2 hours.
Grab the dough at the sides until it has deflated. Allow to rise a second time at room temperature, until it has doubled in size, about 45 minutes.

Remove from the bowl and shape into a long log, about 4 inches wide and 1 foot long. Using a sharp knife, cut in 3 equal-sized pieces. Then cut each of those pieces in half (you will now have 6 pieces). Now cut each of those pieces in half and you will have 12 equal-sized pieces. Each of these pieces will be a roll, but you have to make some more cuts first.
Cut each slice into 3 equal-sized pieces, rolling each into a ball and placing all three into the same well of a greased muffin tin. Repeat for each slice.
Cover with plastic wrap, place in the fridge and allow to double in size, about 1 1/2 hours.
Preheat the oven to 400°F. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

title: herbed red potatoes
directions: Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with water. Place over medium high heat and boil for approximately 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender but not mushy. While the potatoes are boiling, whisk together remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Drain the potatoes and place in a meduim serving bowl. Pour butter/herb mixture over potatoes and gently toss to coat well.

title: fall sangria
directions: In a saucepan, stir together dried fruit, brandy, and honey. Cook over medium-low heat until simmering. Remove from heat; cool slightly.
To a container, add wine, brandy, triple sec, peach schnapps or peach vodka. Stir. Refrigerate up to 24 hours.
To serve, strain sangria into a pitcher. (If desired, fruits can be used as a garnish to add interest.) Add ice cubes and club soda; stir gently.

title: fall dark sangria
directions: Place all ingredients into a large pitcher. Stir gently. Let sit 1-2 hours. Serve cold, place fruit into glass for added color and interest. Keep refrigerated.

title: rainbow paint spill icing
directions: Whisk together milk and powdered sugar, then add corn syrup and vanilla.
Divide the icing into 3 portions and dye each with your colors of choice.

Alternate piping thick films of dyed icing onto the center of a sugar cookie until the colors create a marbled rainbow effect and spill over the sides. Use cooled, flat sugar cookies for the best results.

title: hot toddy
directions: Combine bourbon and maple syrup in a mug. Gradually stir in hot water and then the ground cinnamon. Finish with a lemon wedge.

title: mint chocolate chip green smoothie
directions: Place all ingredients except the chocolate chips in a Blendtec and press the "smoothie function." Once there is only 15 seconds remaining until your smoothie is ready, stop the Blendtec and add the chocolate chips. Blend on the "smoothie" setting for an additional 15 seconds and devour.
